channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Pentagon says Ukraine can have Tomahawk missiles: Report
item.description: The Pentagon has given approval to the White House to send long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, potentially fulfilling President Volodymyr Zelensky's desire for more weapons in his country's war with Russia if President Trump provides the final green light, CNN reported Friday.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Trump designates Nigeria as 'country of particular concern' over widespread Christian persecution, killings
item.description: Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: U.S. national intelligence director Tulsi Gabbard says America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” has ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: South African government criticizes Trump's refugee policy prioritizing white Afrikaner minority
item.description: The South African government has criticized the U.S. policy shift that will give priority to Afrikaners for asylum.
item.dc:creator: Mogomotsi Magome, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New inquest rules South African Nobel laureate Albert Luthuli was beaten to death in 1967
item.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — A new inquest into the 1967 death of South African Nobel Peace Prize winner and anti-apartheid leader Albert Luthuli has found that he was beaten to death, and it rejected a previous finding that he died as a result of being hit by a train.
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Louvre heist highlights thorny issue for museums: How to secure art without becoming fortresses
item.description: The day after the jewelry heist at the Louvre in Paris, officials from across Washington's world-famous museums were already talking, assessing and planning how to bolster their own security.
item.dc:creator: R.J. RICO and JOCELYN NOVECK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Security forces and protesters clash following disputed election in Tanzania; UN says 10 dead
item.description: Protests in Tanzania have entered their third day as the electoral body continues to announce the results of an election that sparked deadly demonstrations, leading to the government’s shutdown of the internet and the deployment of the military.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Cruise ship allegedly leaves 80-year-old woman behind on island, daughter demands answers after death
item.description: Family demands coronial inquest after cruise ship allegedly abandons 80-year-old passenger on remote Australian island, leading to her death during luxury voyage.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Guy Kopelowicz, former Paris photo chief for AP, dies at 85
item.description: Guy Kopelowicz, whose distinguished career editing and leading photo coverage for The Associated Press in France lasted more than four decades, has died. He was 85.
item.dc:creator: TONY HICKS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: CBP seizes 166 exotic pets, including pythons and tarantulas, from car traveling to Mexico
item.description: A total of 166 reptiles and arthropods were identified within the vehicle, including dozens of pythons, numerous lizards, multiple frogs and several tarantulas.
item.dc:creator: Mia Morales, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Red Cross receives two coffins of deceased hostages in Gaza Strip, IDF says
item.description: Israel said the Red Cross reported receiving "two coffins of deceased hostages" during a transfer in the Gaza Strip and is brining the remains to IDF troops.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WGN 9

item.title: Pakistan threatens to 'obliterate' Taliban after peace talks fall apart
item.description: Pakistan threatened to "obliterate" the Taliban after peace talks toward lasting peace between the two sides failed following deadly border clashes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 4 Senate Republicans vote to rebuke Trump in midst of Canada tariff spat
item.description: The Senate voted 50 to 46 on Wednesday to eliminate President Trump’s authority to impose steep tariffs on Canada, something he exercised again in recent days by ramping up tariffs on the country by another 10 percent because of a television ad that criticized his policies.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on as death toll from Gaza strikes reaches 104
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel’s military said Wednesday that the ceasefire was back on in Gaza after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight across the Palestinian territory that killed 104 people, including 66 women and children, according to local health officials.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Mexico worries its citizens might get blown up at sea by US
item.description: “We are not in agreement with these interventions, and we have a protocol that has yielded results,” Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: How to help those impacted by Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica on Tuesday as a devastating Category 5 storm, tied for the strongest landfalling Atlantic hurricane in history. The deadly storm has also caused devastation in Cuba, Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
item.dc:creator: GABRIELA AOUN ANGUEIRA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: As Trump meets Xi, Republicans push for release of detained Americans
item.description: The meeting between Trump and Xi in South Korea is largely focused on coming to a ceasefire in an escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Frontlines with Robert Sherman: All eyes on China, US relationship
item.description: The two heads of state representing the two most powerful economies in the world are set to meet face-to-face within the next few hours.
item.dc:creator: Robert Sherman, NewsNation

item.title: 80-year-old Australian woman dies on island after cruise ship leaves without her
item.description: An 80-year-old Australian woman was found dead after the Coral Adventurer cruise ship allegedly left her behind on Lizard Island during a hiking tour.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump extends friendly hand to Xi in fraught relationship with China
item.description: Friday's meeting marks the first time the two leaders have seen each other face-to-face in six years.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Trump arrives in South Korea for key talks ahead of APEC summit, Xi meeting
item.description: Donald Trump visits Seoul for talks with President Lee Jae Myung focused on trade, investment, and maintaining stability amid growing tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump visits South Korea as he attempts to secure billions in investment
item.description: President Trump met South Korean leader Lee Jae Myung in Gyeongju, discussing partnerships during the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US sending strike boats to Venezuela for 'shock and awe' effect: Senator
item.description: "I think maybe the president is sending a message that, look, we're serious about it," Sen. Mike Rounds told "On Balance.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, NewsNation

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio police raids ahead of climate conferences
item.description: Police have often conducted large-scale operations against criminal groups ahead of major events in Rio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Photos as Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm
item.description: "Don't bet against Melissa because you will lose," warned Jamaican Government Minister Desmond McKenzie.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation
